body.p: To his Excellency Governor Thomas E Bramlette.

The undersigned would respectfully state that at the present October term of Pendleton Circuit Court Thomas Collopy of the town of Falmouth in Said County was found guilty of the offenses of keeping a tipling house for three months and of keeping a tipling house. and that his fine was assessed at two hundred. and at Sixty dollars respectively.

We know Mr Collopy well. being his neighbors, and we respectfully state that he was a coffee house keeper in the town of Falmouth. that he is a one armed man. and of limited education consequently unable to make a living except in Some light business such as he now pursues. He is a quiet peacable and industrious citizen and knowing him well we can confidently say that since the committing of the offenses of which he has just been convicted he has in no manner violated the law in reference to his business -- and if he is compelled to pay the full amount of his aforesaid fines he will be stripped of all his means. and rendered destitute -- believing that he has not for months past violated any law and thus he will not again offend. we respectfully and earnestly ask of your Excellency that you remit his said fines in part or in whole as far as. you by law can do so. Falmouth Ky Oct 22d 1864.
